column1: A man and his son were once going with their Donkey to market. As they were walking along by its side a countryman passed them and said: "You fools
column2: what is a Donkey for but to ride upon?"So the Man put the Boy on the Donkey and they went on their way. But soon they passed a group of men
column3: one of whom said: "See that lazy youngster
column4: he lets his father walk while he rides."So the Man ordered his Boy to get off
column5: and got on himself. But they hadn't gone far when they passed two women
column6: one of whom said to the other: "Shame on that lazy lout to let his poor little son trudge along."Well
column7: the Man didn't know what to do
column8: but at last he took his Boy up before him on the Donkey. By this time they had come to the town
column9: and the passers-by began to jeer and point to them. The Man stopped and asked what they were scoffing at. The men said: "Aren't you ashamed of yourself for overloading that poor Donkey of yours-you and your hulking son?"
